This game was one of the most fundamental aspects of my childhood, and out of morbid curiosity and nostalgia, I decided to return to this game just for the sake of memories. But I was greeted by possibly the most greedy game I had ever seen. Seriously, they've pulled ALL the strings this time. Advertisements, 'promotions', limited editions, and so much more. The game is literally unplayable. No wonder this game lost almost all of its old players. I'd rather play Tetris than this now.

okay, this is an honest critique I have about this game. the game is fine, don't get me wrong, I used to play it a lot in 2015. But looking at it now, it feels like a nightmare to play. The pvp is unbalanced, the currency is a hassle to even get without participating in events, gambling, or using your mom's credit card, the grinding feels slow, the rewards you get after a match completion feel underwhelming, and again... the pvp just feels unfair. You can't just put a level 5 against a lvl 100.

Microtransactions are the fastest way to level up, the game can be fun but you will run into an occaisonal cheater and it will ruin your whole experience. Game needs some form of anti-cheat and a better way to level up weapons and gear without spending real money.

Please either remove crossplay entirely or implement a feature to disable it. Crossplay creates an unbalanced playing field, leading to frustrating matches with players who have 40+ win streaks and often appear to be using cheats, such as aimbot. This makes the game unfair, especially for mobile players, who face disadvantages. A disable crossplay option would greatly improve the experience and competitiveness for mobile players. Either remove crossplay or allow us to turn it off.

I'm writing this review to share my major gripes with the game. The first thing is that the game got hit by inflation harder than the housing market because stuff is so expensive while the currency is not anywhere near common enough to compensate. This app used to be fun, but now it is just soulless microtransactions and gambling. Every new thing is just Pay2Win. Cubic Games just keep making poor business decisions after poor business decisions. It is just a husk of its former self. I am very disappointed in what Pixel Gun 3D has become over the years. I would rate this 2.5 stars, but Google Play doesn't allow half stars.

EDITED: Playing 3.5 yrs. It was great (not perfect) initially. 2024 added Steam: horrific (broken, P2W, hackers, often literally unplayable). They've improved it again, incl more free, but you'll still be in matches w Steam players on full gaming rigs: those games are HORRIBLY unplayable. Mobile vets mostly gone. Mobile noobs get slaughtered too quick - no fun. If they ever DISABLE X-PLAY, I'll change this to a 5-star rating again. Until then, EXPECT YOU'LL HATE NOT BEING ABLE COMPETE VS PC.

Pixel Gun 3D was an incredible mobile shooter I played from 2016 to 2019, filled with exciting game modes, unique weapons, and constant updates. The maps were diverse, offering different playstyles, while the frequent events kept things fresh. Clan Wars and Battle Royale made multiplayer thrilling, and unlocking powerful guns felt rewarding. The pixelated graphics added charm, making every match enjoyable. Even though I stopped playing, the memories will always be retained in my heart forever.

Pixel Gun 3D has often been criticized for its shift toward a pay-to-win (P2W) model, which has alienated many long-time players and diminished the game's appeal. The game now heavily favors those who invest real money into premium weapons, armor, and upgrades, creating a significant disparity between paying and non-paying players. Many of the most powerful weapons are locked behind paywalls or require grinding an unreasonable amount of in-game currency, which is difficult to earn.

The matchmaking system feels unbalanced, especially for leveling up. New players often face highly skilled opponents or those with overpowered weapons, creating a frustrating and unfair experience. This issue is even worse for mobile players, where aiming and rotating quickly is difficult. Enemies spamming weapons mid-air further worsen the gameplay. A skill-based matchmaking system that considers player level, gear, and platform could greatly improve fairness and overall enjoyment.
